column4: How could I set up a script to bzip2 the contents of a directory individually. I have a directory of .bsp files and I'd like to compress them all to .bsp.bz2 individually.
cd to the directory and do 'for file in *.bsp; do bzip2 $file; done;'
Can I just enter that as a single command?
do you understand what it's doing?
For each file that ends in .bsp, runs the bzip2 command for it
yep - so yes - you can cd into the directory where the files are and give it a go
Thanks, I'll give it try once I've finished grabbing them
would that command you gave me compress each file linearly or all at once?
sorry - stepped away for a bit - the command steps through each file individually
For the command you gave me earlier, could I make it recurse into subdirectories?
you might want to investigate the 'find' command for that kind of thing - with that command, for each file that matches the parameters you give it, excecute a command
do a web search for "find exec"
